sen.j: 細川信良（ほそかわ のぶよし、天文 (元号)17年（1548年） - 文禄元年（1592年））は戦国時代 (日本)、安土桃山時代の武将・大名。
sen.e: Nobuyoshi HOSOKAWA (1548 to 1592) was a 'busho (Japanese military commander)' and feudal lord over the age of civil wars and the Azuchi Momoyama Period.
Nobuyoshi HOSOKAWA (1548 - 1592) was a busho (Japanese military commander) and feudal lord over the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States, Japan) and the Azuchi-Momoyama period.
sen.cmt: 用語集に合わせました。

sen.j: 室町時代に栄えた細川氏の本流である「京兆家」の直系子孫。
sen.e: He was a direct descent of 'the Keicho clan,' which was prosperous during the Muromach Period.
He was a direct descent of 'the Keicho family,' the main lineage of Hosokawa clan which was prosperous during the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 幼名は六郎、聡明丸。
sen.e: His child name was Rokuro, Someimaru.

sen.j: 管領細川晴元の子、母は六角定頼娘。

sen.j: 子に細川元勝（頼範）、娘は秋田実季室。
sen.e: His son was Motokatsu (Yorinori) HOSOKAWA, and his daughter became Sanesue AKITA's wife.

sen.j: 弟に細川晴之。
sen.e: His younger brother was Haruyuki HOSOKAWA.
Haruyuki HOSOKAWA was his younger brother.

sen.j: 父晴元が三好長慶と一時的に和睦した際に人質となる。
sen.e: When his father, Harumoto, temporarily made peace with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, Nobuyoshi became Nagayoshi's hostage.
When his father, Harumoto, temporarily made peace with Nagayoshi MIYOSHI, Nobuyoshi was taken hostage by Nagayoshi.

sen.j: その後、父が長慶と敵対すると管領細川氏綱と共に淀古城に軟禁され、1558年に長慶の下で元服した。
sen.e: Afterward, when Harumoto became hostile to Nagayoshi, Nobuyoshi was placed under house arrest, together with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA, a shogunal deputy, in Yodo ko-jo Castle and in 1558 celebrated his attainment of manhood under Nagayoshi's guidance.

sen.j: 晴元が長慶と和睦すると父と久々の対面を果たしている。
sen.e: When his father, Harumoto, made peace with Nagayoshi again, Nobuyoshi met his father after a long interval.

sen.j: 隠居、病没した父の跡を継ぐものの、勢力は取り戻せず、管領であった氏綱の没後も管領職に任命されることはなかった。
sen.e: Although Nobuyoshi succeeded to the position of his father, who retired and then died of disease, he could not become influential nor was he appointed to be 'Kanryo shoku (a post of shogunal deputy)' after the death of Ujitsuna, who used to be a shogunal deputy.

Although Nobuyoshi succeeded to the position of his father, who retired and then died of disease, he could not become influential, and he was not appointed to the position of kanrei after the death of Ujitsuna, who used to be a kanrei.

sen.j: 永禄の変の後、足利義栄を擁立する三好氏により名目上の管領として処遇を受ける。
sen.e: After Eiroku Incident, Nobuyoshi was treated as a nominal shogunal deputy by the Miyoshi clan, who backed up Yoshihide ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: が、足利義昭を伴なって織田信長が上洛すると、当初は野田城・福島城の戦いにおいて織田軍と対峙したが、やがて将軍となった足利義昭に臣下の礼をとった。
sen.e: When Nobunaga Oda came to Kyoto, accompanying Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, Nobuyoshi at first confronted the Oda army at the Battle of Noda-jo Castle and Fukushima-jo Castle, but then he came to serve for Yoshiaki ASHIKAGA, who became the 15th Shogun.

sen.j: このころ義昭より一字拝領を受けて京兆家の当主らしく「細川昭元」と名乗る。
sen.e: Around that time, since Yoshiaki gave one letter of his name, 'Aki' to Nobuyoshi, Nobuyoshi changed his name into 'Akimoto HOSOKAWA,' a suitable name for the family head of Kiccho family.

sen.j: 名目上摂津の旗頭とされた。

sen.j: 信長の勢力下では、1572年には摂津国で本願寺の下間頼龍・下間頼純と交戦して敗北するなど武功には恵まれなかった。
sen.e: Under Nobunaga's control, Akimoto's military exploits were defeated; for example, in 1572, in Settsu Province, he fought against Rairyu SHIMOTSUMA and Raijun SHIMOZUMA of Hongwan-ji Temple and was defeated.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: が、室町幕府の幕臣対策として利用された。
sen.e: Yet, he was used to deal with Shogun's retainers of Muromachi bakufu.
